properties.summary: Ice on deck
ETD HARLINGEN 10:00
Boat training with the MYAS sailing
MAR 30th: 6 Campaign Team Members attended Fisheries meeting in Paroikia (Nisos Paros)
The fuel was checked by Chief Eng Dave.
moved from dry dock to pier
Stop ME, 23:45 Star ME
Ship Shifted form position 6 to 5 Kimek shipyard

AS under tow by Russian Coast Guard Vessel "LADOGA", Course  252, speed 2k, destination Murmansk..AS stopped -made fast to Russian Coast Guard Vessel "LADOGA" anchored off Murmansk... AS fast to Russian Coast Guard Vessel "LADOGA" anchored off Murmansk, last position alert from SSAS, all 30 persons including crew taken off AS and sent to various locations at Murmansk for detention /investigation. Ships
AS fast to Russian Coast Guard Vessel "LADOGA" anchored off Murmansk, no poistion alerts, ship immobilized and unmanned

AS fast to Russian Coast Guard Vessel "LADOGA" anchored off Murmansk, no poistion alerts, ship immobilized and unmanned.Court proceedings for al 30 persons most detained for 2 months pending piracy investigation by FSB

AS fast to Russian Coast Guard Vessel "LADOGA" anchored off Murmansk, no poistion alerts, ship immobilized and unmanned. Reports received indicate FSB investigators on board to collect evidence during daytime . Not clear
shifted back to original berth @ JP Nelson
The Esperanza sailing into an Indian ocean sunset.
The Greenpeace ship Esperanza is operating in the Indian Ocean to document and record fishing vessels that are operating illegally or using highly destructive and wasteful fishing techniques..
Crew change by launch at Colombo

NEWS: Today a group of Mauritian artisanal fishermen, who are witnessing their catch steadily declining because of poor fisheries management and wasteful and destructive fishing fleets emptying their waters of fish, protested with Greenpeace ahead of the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission (IOTC) meeting in Mauritius this week.
Around 600 people came to visit the Esperanza while she's on anchor in La Reunion
ship performance affected by counter current and strong wind (BF7)
We’re currently headed for Southeast Asia to put a spotlight on the need to protect marine life from overfishing in the region. First stop: Thailand!
We're in Apo Island, Dauin, Negros Oriental in the Philippines, the first stop for our Ocean Defender Tour in the country.
shifting from berth no 9 to no 31 due to heavy swell

When two opposing air streams meet, they create an island of storm and thunder called the doldrums. It is also considered the birthplace of giant tropical storms. With perpetual darkened skies, the Espy sails through the ocean of doldrums.
E drive off, commenced drifting
E drive on, vessel underway
vessel underway
Greenpeace Esperanza, one of three Greenpeace ships that travel the world to campaign on environmental issues,  visiting Suva.
Departure Princess Wharf 0810 Arrival Anchorage
open boat visitors: 315
Greenpeace, Rainbow Warrior crew and East Coast Whanau a Apanui celebrate the end of Petrobras's deep sea oil drilling ambitions on the East Coast http://act.gp/V3XiWY
In February we sailed through the Cook Strait on the Rainbow Warrior - very close to where Texan oil company Anadarko wants to carry out high risk deep sea oil drilling in the Pegasus Basin.
Main Engine ran to meet required speed in pilotage area affected by strong tidal currents.
Moved anchorage. The Rainbow Warrior’s tour to Save the Reef is continuing up the Queensland coast.
Delayed by cyclon "Zane".The Rainbow Warrior is in Indonesia to document one of the world’s most biodiverse and threatened environments.
On his way to Jakarta, on World Environment Day, the Rainbow Warrior was greeted by hundreds of fishing boats from Batang regency, Central Java.
Due to weather conditions we proceed to anchor in Kellet anchorage.
Boat Training - This is Ahmad "Kocil" Ramdani, he is a volunteer from Indonesia who is working on board as deckhand. He is in the climbing and boat driving team of Indonesia.
Ship departs in the morning for action in Gori Nuclear Plant -We had company on our way to the nuclear power station.
Open Day - The campaigning in Taiwan has finished here in An-Ping. Thanks to the volunteers and fundraisers for their hard work these days!
Distance under Main Engine because of berth shifting.
Seattle, it's been amazing! We set sail for Vancouver, Washington this morning...what great weather!
Boat Training. And Arctic 3 as well as projections in Portland last night... Everything to raise awareness and #FreeTheArctic30 our friends in Russia
Ship will shift berth, for bunkering.
